summary: The Ellie Helton, Lisa Colagrossi, Kristen Shafer Englert, Teresa Anne Lawrence, and Jennifer Sedney Focused Research Act, also known as Ellie’s Law, aims to increase research funding for unruptured intracranial aneurysms. The bill highlights the prevalence and impact of brain aneurysms, citing statistics on prevalence, mortality, and financial costs. It authorizes $20 million annually from 2026-2030 to the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS) for this research, with the funds to remain available through September 30, 2033.
